author: Staff Reporter
text:
Prasar Bharati released a DVD of violinist Srimathi Brahmanandam’s contribution to carnatic music under the series ‘Maestros of India’ on Thursday.

Lalgudi family hailed

Speaking on the occasion, Suresh Chandra Panda, member personnel of Prasar Bharati, said the entire family of Lalgudi Jayaraman had dedicated themselves to this art form. “Listening to violinists like Srimathi Brahmanandam is sheer bliss. You feel as peaceful as you are when you pray,” Mr. Panda said. Ms. Brahmanandam is Mr. Jayaraman’s sister.

The proceeds of the DVD titled ‘Lalgudi Srimathi Brahmanandam, VIOLIN’ will be donated to the flood-relief work in Chennai.

Mridangam exponent T.V. Gopalakrishnan recollected his association with musician Mr. Jayaraman and his family. “When Lalgudi and Srimathi played together, they brought out the best of music. He would play and leave it to her to continue and finish. Though both of them play in sync, you can actually know how beautifully both minds work and are extremely creative and dedicated,” he added.

Composer Spencer Venugopal noted that there was a lot of depth and purity in the ‘Lalgudi’ bani of music.

“If you just close your eyes and listen to Lalgudi Jayaraman and Srimathi play, it would sound as one,” he said.

“It is hard to come across someone like her these days,” he added.

Anuradha Sridhar, daughter of Ms. Brahmanandam, presented a concert on the occasion.
title: Violinist’s works released
